thread.title: Five pedestrians taken to hospital after horror crash
thread.title_full: Five pedestrians taken to hospital after horror crash

title: Five pedestrians taken to hospital after horror crash
text: comments Five people have been taken to hospital after a car ploughed into pedestrians in south London. The incident happened near Catford Bus Garage in Bellingham this morning when the car left the road and crashed into a wall. A number of pedestrians were hurt and the road is closed while police investigate. The incident happened on this road near Catford Bus Garage in Bellingham this morning Witness Jonathan Brown wrote on Facebook: 'Big car crash on Bromley Road... tons of police, ambulances, even helicopter landed in PC world... one person trapped under a car and two others injured.... at the car wash... my thought and prayers are with them.' A Scotland Yard spokesman said: 'Police were called at approximately 08:20hrs on Sunday, 26 February to reports of a car in collision with a wall and a number of pedestrians on Bromley Road in Bellingham. 'Officers, the London Ambulance Service and London's Air Ambulance attended. Five people were treated at the scene. 'They have all been taken to south and east London hospitals. We await an update on their condition. 'The driver of the car was detained at the scene by an off-duty police officer before being arrested on suspicion of causing serious injury by dangerous driving. Road closures are in place.' Witnesses said one of the those hit is thought to have become trapped beneath the car Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
